item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 207.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

summary.text: Directs the President to reimburse an individual or entity that owns or operates a facility used as an emergency shelter for Hurricane Katrina survivors for 100% of the business revenue lost as a result of cancellation of revenue-raising events during the Hurricane Katrina disaster period as determined by the state involved.

bill.title: A bill to provide for reimbursement for business revenue lost as a result of a facility being used as an emergency shelter for Katrina Survivors.

item.title: A bill to provide for reimbursement for business revenue lost as a result of a facility being used as an emergency shelter for Katrina Survivors.
A bill to provide for reimbursement for business revenue lost as a result of a facility being used as an emergency shelter for Katrina Survivors.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
